docs.snippet: Migrants forming a caravan in southern Mexico are subject to an administrative migratory procedure, the Mexican foreign ministry said on Monday, after the caravan drew the ire of U.S. President Donald Trump.

headline.print_headline: Mexico Says Migrants in Caravan Face Administrative Procedure
headline.main: Mexico Says Migrants in Caravan Face Administrative Procedure

docs.snippet: A senior Republican senator on Sunday warned U.S. President Donald Trump against pulling U.S. troops from Syria, saying it would lead to a resurgence of Islamic State and increased Iranian sway over the Syrian government in Damascus.

headline.print_headline: Republican Senator Graham Warns Against Syria Troop Withdrawal
headline.main: Republican Senator Graham Warns Against Syria Troop Withdrawal

docs.snippet: The Latest on the Trump administration's proposed 25 percent tariffs on $50 billion in Chinese imports to protest Beijing's alleged theft of American technology. (all times local):

headline.print_headline: The Latest: China's Commerce Ministry Warns of Retaliation
headline.main: The Latest: China's Commerce Ministry Warns of Retaliation

docs.snippet: Senior Chinese diplomat Yang Jiechi told South Korean President Moon Jae-in on Friday that all parties must seize the moment to advance talks between leaders of North and South Korea, and between North Korea and the United States.

headline.print_headline: China Envoy Tells Moon All Sides Must Advance Talks on Korean Peninsula
headline.main: China Envoy Tells Moon All Sides Must Advance Talks on Korean Peninsula

docs.snippet: U.S. manufacturers say they expanded at a slower pace in March, with many factories saying they're having a tough time getting supplies in order to meet demand from customers.

headline.print_headline: Pace of US Factory Growth Slipped in March
headline.main: Pace of US Factory Growth Slipped in March

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's unscripted remark this week about pulling out of Syria "very soon," while at odds with his own policy, was not a one-off: For weeks, top advisers have been fretting about an overly hasty withdrawal as the president has inc...

headline.main: Trump's Talk of a Syria Pullout Nothing New

docs.snippet: The Secretary of State was roundly criticized by a demoralized diplomatic corps for gutting budgets. But to allies he was “one of the grown-ups.”

headline.print_headline: Tillerson’s Ouster Has Allies Hoping for Coherence, but Fearing the Worst
headline.main: Tillerson’s Ouster Has Allies Hoping for Coherence, but Fearing the Worst

docs.snippet: The United States has agreed to exempt South Korea from steel tariffs, South Korea's trade ministry said on Monday, instead imposing a quota on steel imports as the two countries renegotiate a trade deal sharply criticized by U.S. President Donald...

headline.print_headline: U.S. Agrees to Exempt South Korea From Steel Tariffs, but Imposes Import Quota-South Korea
